author: chrisrostance
title: Perfect for sightseeing
text:
We stayed here for 7 nights and was really impressed by everything here.
We basically wanted somewhere to sleep and shower and relax as most of the day we would be out sightseeing.
This hotel hit the spot .
To start of with it's only a 3 minutes walk to Times Square, and this is where all the sightseeing buses leave. Or the subway station is a 5 minute walk, maximum.
The hotel itself isn't the newest or the smartest, but it's very cheap and clean.
For the price it is an amazing hotel.
The staff were all so friendly and helpful. We had lots of questions as tourist do!!! And the staff were always more than happy to help.
There was one guy on reception called pranay who was amazing.
We asked him if he knew of any local restaurants away from the tourist parts , the next thing we knew he had printed 3 pages off of all good local restaurants. We visited 3 of them and they were great. ( a little advice if you go there, head towards 9th avenue for a lot better, choice, price and quality food)
The breakfast at the hotel is just what you need to set yourself up for the day , light but filling. There is always coffee, tea, water etc available at reception to take away or drink there , and cookies in the afternoon.
There's only one "bad" thing at the hotel and that's nothing to do with hotel. But expect a lot of noise 24 hours a day. Police, fire engines, taxi etc.... all day long. But it's central New York so that goes without saying really.
I would totally recommend this hotel for anyone going sightseeing. Great and cheap and central for everything. And don't forget the great staff.
Thanks for making our trip amazing
